pullRequest.body:
The subgroup of the type of units added in this PR is something we have in other guises, which are somewhat less useful for some forms of working. The intention is to provide different options depending on how you want to think about the group of units in a submonoid.

---
This PR came out of this Zulip chat. https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Submonoid.20units

The discovery of the Galois connection currently mentioned in the todo has convinced me this is a useful construction which we should have. I have further work which depends on this but I want to focus on this PR first.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion map_mul' x y := by simp_rw [Units.val_mul]; rfl ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ((x : M) ∈ S ∧ ((x⁻¹ : Mˣ) : M) ∈ S) := Iff.rfl ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (x : Mˣ) : x ∈ S.units ↔ ((x : M) ∈ S) := by rw [S.mem_units_iff, h, and_self] ```

```suggestion (x : M) ∈ S := ((S.mem_units_iff _).mp h).1 ```

```suggestion ((x : Mˣ) : M) ∈ S := S.coe_mem_of_mem_units (SetLike.coe_mem _) ```

```suggestion ((x⁻¹ : Mˣ) : M) ∈ S := ((S.mem_units_iff _).mp h).2 ```

```suggestion ((x⁻¹ : Mˣ) : M) ∈ S := S.coe_inv_mem_of_mem_units (SetLike.coe_mem _) ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (h₁ : (x : M) ∈ S) (h₂ : ((x⁻¹ : Mˣ) : M) ∈ S) : x ∈ S.units := ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ((x⁻¹ : Sˣ) : M) * ((x : Sˣ) : M) = 1 := congrArg ((↑) : S → M) (Units.inv_mul _) ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ((x : Sˣ) : M) * ((x⁻¹ : Sˣ) : M) = 1 := congrArg ((↑) : S → M) (Units.mul_inv _) ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ((x⁻¹ : Mˣ) : M) * ((x : Mˣ) : M) = 1 := Units.inv_mul _ ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ((x : Mˣ) : M) * ((x⁻¹ : Mˣ) : M) = 1 := Units.mul_inv _ ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion H.toSubmonoid.map (Units.coeHom M) ≤ S ↔ H ≤ S.units := by ```
Can `simps symm_apply` on `toUnits` generate this lemma?
Probably! I will try it and see.
Yes, and `val_apply` generates the existing one, as it happens. Have added both in most recent patch.
If you want it to be called coe_apply instead I can do this but I can't recall the syntax for renaming simp lemmas. If there's any others to derive I'm not sure what they would be.
@urkud Would you prefer it to be called `val_apply` or `coe_apply`, and if the latter, could you remind me how to choose the name?

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (h₂ : x ∈ S.ofUnits) : h₁.unit = S.unit_of_mem_ofUnits h₂ := Units.ext <| rfl ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (h₂ : x ∈ S.ofUnits) : h₁.unit ∈ S := ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (h₂ : h₁.unit ∈ S) : x ∈ S.ofUnits := S.mem_ofUnits h₂ h₁.unit_spec ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion x ∈ S.ofUnits ↔ ∃ h : IsUnit x, h.unit ∈ S := ```
Maybe reverse the two sides? The RHS seems more complicated than the LHS (asking since it is `simp`).
Perhaps it shouldn't be simp.
Removed simp attribute.

```suggestion
  ⟨fun ⟨⟨_, hm, he⟩, _⟩ => (Units.ext he) ▸ hm, fun hm => ⟨⟨_, hm, rfl⟩, _, S.inv_mem hm, rfl⟩⟩)
```
The less parenthesis the more readable in my opinion, but as you prefer.
I agree, thanks for this.
I think the name should be `ofUnits_le_iff` or something similar.
Righto, will look at this.

```suggestion
lemma units_iInf {ι : Sort*} (f : ι → Submonoid M) : (iInf f).units = ⨅ (i : ι), (f i).units :=
```
Sure.

```suggestion
lemma units_iInf₂ {ι : Sort*} {κ : ι → Sort*} (f : (i : ι) → κ i → Submonoid M) :
```
Sure.
Can you put `(y : M) ∈ S.ofUnits` as an assumption rather than proving the implication?
Oh - I could, but this was deliberate as it destructures nicely.
To Lean the two versions should be exactly the same thing.
No, because if I put it in the hypothesis I can't deconstruct it in the same way.

```
@[to_additive]
lemma mem_of_mem_coe_ofUnits (S : Subgroup Mˣ) {y : Mˣ} (hy : (y : M) ∈ S.ofUnits ): y ∈ S :=
  match hy with 
  | ⟨_, hm, he⟩ => (Units.ext he) ▸ hm
  ```
  
  This is the alternative - it is longer! But I will change it for now.
Same here.
As in, make `x` explicit?
Oh I see.
Same as previous, resolve there if necessary.

```suggestion
    S.unit_of_mem_ofUnits h = x := Units.ext rfl
```
Oops!

```suggestion
    (h₂ : x ∈ S.ofUnits) : h₁.unit = S.unit_of_mem_ofUnits h₂ := Units.ext rfl
```

```suggestion
lemma ofUnits_sSup (s: Set (Subgroup Mˣ)) : (sSup s).ofUnits = ⨆ S ∈ s, S.ofUnits :=
```

```suggestion
lemma ofUnits_iSup₂ {ι : Sort*} {κ : ι → Sort*} (f : (i : ι) → κ i → Subgroup Mˣ) :
```

```suggestion
def unitsUnitsEquivUnits [Monoid M] : Mˣˣ ≃* Mˣ := toUnits.symm
```
Why do you need this special case of `toUnits`?
I was sort of thinking it would be useful as a simp-type thing I think? Like it's a thing about taking units being idempotent. But I take your point.

```suggestion
variable {M : Type*} [Monoid M]
```
